nameEntry.part: Canterbury City Council Library Local History Photograph Collection

biogHist.abstract: The Canterbury City Council Library Local History Photograph Collection contains thousands of images of the Canterbury local government area and is held by the City of Canterbury Library. The collection has been digitised and is available online as Pictorial Canterbury and via Trove. Pictorial Canterbury consists of six major collections of digitised images including the Protestant Federation Home collection, which contains images of people and buildings at the New South Wales Protestant Federation Children's Home.
biogHist.p: Digital copies of the photographs are available online. Each image has individual copyright and acknowledgement instructions attached.

The smaller collection, Protestant Federation Home, consists of more than 160 group shots, portraits, building photographs and illuminated addresses from the New South Wales Protestant Federation Children's Home. Many of the subjects of the portraits from the Home have been identified.
Many of the photographs in this collection were donated to the Canterbury City Council Library, or the Library was given access to their private photograph collections for copying.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Canterbury City Council Library - Contact Details
New South Wales Protestant Federation Children's Home (1921 - 1980)

descriptiveNote.p: The City of Canterbury Local History Photography Collection contains photographs of children, staff and old girls from the New South Wales Protestant Federation Children's Home (1921- ). This collection is digitised at Pictorial Canterbury. To see the photos type "protestant federation' into the Pictorial Canterbury search box.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Canterbury City Council Library Local History Photograph Collection', in Find & Connect - New South Wales,

archref.repository: Canterbury City Council Library Local History Photography Collection: Protestant Children's Home (courtesy Anne Maher and Mary Brown)
archref.abstract: This is a digital copy of an image in the Protestant Children's Home collection in the Canterbury City Council Library Local History Photograph Collection. The description given states 'NSW Protestant Federation Home, 50 Garnet Street, Hurlstone Park.'

archref.unittitle: Protestant Federation Home, [portrait], Hurlstone Park, ca 1942
archref.abstract: This is a digital copy of an image in the Protestant Children's Home collection in the Canterbury City Council Library Local History Photograph Collection. The description states 'Birds cage in the playground. Note the hall window painted over. This was to prevent light escaping at night in the event of air raids during the war.'
archref.note: Courtesy Anne Maher and Mary Brown and City of Canterbury Local History Photograph Collection
